duties_responsibilities.duty: Check the ticket system for new maintenance requests every morning
Acknowledge that tickets have been read by changing the status to pending, put notes in the system daily, and change the status in the system as the status changes.
Create a ticket in the ticket system for any work performed that is not already on a ticket.
Fulfill maintenance requests given by Children’s Harbor staff thru the facilities ticket system app daily.
Repairing, servicing, and up-keep of buildings and homes
Assists with maintaining building security
On-call for emergencies 24/7, on-call will be scheduled on a rotating basis
Campus safety, report concerns to Facilities Director
Walkthrough of all the houses monthly (Per DCF guidelines)
Makes minor plumbing repairs, as necessary
Assists with departmental and employee office moves
Make trips to the hardware store when in need of supplies
Reporting of negligence
Ensure that buildings are rust free
Check grounds on a weekly basis for ant piles, and wasp nests; treat them accordingly
Identify and submit a request for repairs that require professional expertise to Facilities Director for approval
Monitors contractor performance and works closely with outside vendors and contractors to ensure work is completed according to specifications
Performs basic electrical work and determines when an electrician is required
Hangs pictures and shelving, as needed
Dismantles and installs furniture
Transport goods or equipment as assigned
Test landscape irrigation system bi-monthly
Ensure that garbage is picked up on campus daily
Assist with donations distribution
Assist with CH vehicles maintenance and repairs
Assist with events set up and clean up
Assist with volunteers’ projects
Perform vehicle maintenance inspection and clean vehicles monthly.
Ensure facility maintenance and facilities/grounds are clean, orderly, and in child-safe conditions always.
Ensure and coordinate vehicle maintenance.
Reports any physical safety issues to the Director of Facilities/Director of Operations.

Performs a variety of cleaning activities such as sweeping, mopping, dusting, and polishing all common areas (staff bathrooms, kitchens, hallways, conference rooms, offices, and common areas in the Administration building)
Ensure all rooms/houses are inspected according to DCF and CH standards
Notify the Facilities Director of any damages in the homes

Daily sanitization of Main campus and Lauderhill common/high transit areas (staff bathrooms, kitchens, hallways, conference rooms, offices, doorknobs, and campus grounds) following CDC and OSHA guidelines
Washing windows as needed
Pressure cleaning sidewalks as needed
Monitoring and tracking cleaning supplies and placing orders with prior approval of the Facilities Director
Reporting any necessary repairs or replacements to Facilities Director

education_certification.credential: Two years of working experience in facility maintenance. Knowledge of general maintenance trades.Mechanical knowledge, which includes knowledge of tools.Knowledge of and experience in cleaning and sanitizing rooms following proper CDC guidelines.
